formalText: Her psychiatrist in the hospital lives next to her.
She's not sure how much better she feels, but certainly better enough to be out of the hospital.
Her mind is just kind of blank.
She has the Impressions that she thinks she's going to go back to being bad.
It's not like the most okay ever, but she thinks she's okay.
She just doesn't know what to say.
She just feels like she should just be able to let go of the anxiety.
She doesn't seem to have that many kind of annoying side effects.
She personally thinks that's been okay.
If she's losing things, she's losing them completely enough that she doesn't know that it's gone, which is good enough.
